intro: Erigeron discernendus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
